org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizers

Annotation Type DefineIn


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=PARAMETER)
public @interface DefineIn
    Used to dynamically set List or array arguments as attributes on the StatementContext for the statement generated for this method. For example: 

     
  @SqlUpdate("insert into  <table > ( <columns >) values ( <values >)")
 int insert(@Define String table, @DefineIn List <String > columns, @BindIn("values") List <Object > values);
 
 

     
  @SqlQuery("select  <columns > from  <table > where id = :id")
 ResultSet select(@DefineIn("columns") List <String > columns, @Define("table") String table, @Bind("id") long id);

    A List argument passed to @DefineIn will be converted to a comma-separated String and set as a whole as a single specified attribute. Duplicate members in the List may cause SQL exceptions. An empty List or null members in the List will result in an IllegalArgumentException.

    Be aware of the list members you're binding with @DefineIn, as there is no input sanitization! Blindly passing Strings through @DefineIn may make your application vulnerable to SQL Injection.

    See Also:
    Define

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String value
      The key for the attribute to set.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract String value
        The key for the attribute to set. The value will be the value passed to the annotated argument
        Returns:
        the attribute key
        Default:
        ""
